locations.desc: The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore
locations.details: Its name combines mer, meaning the sea, and lion. The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means sea town in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning lion city or kota singa.
